title: San Juan Island National Historical Park: Current Conditions
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Current Conditions              Current Conditions        South Beach at American Camp is major attraction for islanders and visitors alike with nearly two miles of saltwater shoreline and splendid views of the Olympics and Victoria. This shot was taken Dec. 5, 2015 with southeast winds gusting to nearly 60 mph. Mike Vouri   Â        Click on the National Weather Service logo (above) to learn the latest about San Juan Island weather. NOAA  American Camp  Winter: All trails open. Winters along the Strait of Juan de Fuca are characterized by chill winds, especially out of the southeast. Northeast winds combined with rain will bring snow. However, sun breaks occur, which means great hiking. Remember it is unlawful to hunt or trap on all public lands on San Juan Island.  English Camp  Winter: All trails are open. Several ponds will appear on the parade ground, which was a saltwater marsh before human started occupying the site more than 2,000 years ago. The main Young Hill trail can be slick when wet near the summit. How to Contact Us Our headquarters offices in Friday Harbor are open Monday-Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Call 360-378-2221 or 2222. The American Camp visitor center is open Wednesday-Sunday, 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Call 360-378-2240, ext. 2226 or 2227 for current information, or to report downed trees or other hazardous trail conditions.
